name: Gaye Advert
description: English musician. Played bass guitar in The Adverts in the late 1970s. One of the 1st female stars of the punk rock movement. In 1979, Advert stopped playing bass and disappeared from the British punk scene.

name: Poly Styrene
description: Half-British, half-Somali pioneer of punk rock music and the leader of the short-lived but influential band X-Ray Spex. Her lyrics and ideas surrounding consumerism, feminism, racism, and the environment are still relevant today.

name: Pauline Murray
description: British singer, musician and songwriter from County Durham, UK. She started her career in music as lead singer of the band Penetration before recording and releasing under her own name in 1980 backed by The Invisible Girls.

name: Lora Logic
description: British saxophonist and singer. She was briefly a member of the band X-Ray Spex and formed Essential Logic. She also played on recordings by The Raincoats, The Stranglers, Kollaa Kestää and Swell Maps and, later, Boy George.

name: Jordan
description: English model and actress noted for her work with Vivienne Westwood and the Sex boutique in the Kings Road area of London in the mid-1970s. Her style made her a highly visible icon of the London punk subculture.

name: Soo Catwoman
description: Soo Catwoman, was associated with the London punk subculture that sprang up around the mid-1970s. In 'The Filth and the Fury', Johnny Rotten singles her out among the early London punks, citing her 'skill, style, and bravery'.

name: Viv Westwood
description: English fashion designer and businesswoman, largely responsible for bringing modern punk and new wavefashions into the mainstream.

name: Chrissie Hynde
description: American singer-songwriter and musician. She is a founding member and the guitarist, lead vocalist, and primary songwriter of the rock band the Pretenders, as well as its only constant member.

name: Palmolive
description: Spanish-born drummer and songwriter who was a member of influential early punk bands. She founded the Slits toward the end of 1976. After leaving that group in 1978, she joined the Raincoats.

name: Ari Up
description: German vocalist. In 1976, at the age of 14, she went to see the Clash and met a drummer called Palmolive and together they founded the Slits. The first song the two played together was “Blitzkrieg Bop” by the Ramones.

name: Viv Albertine
description: Australian-born British musician, singer, songwriter and writer. She is best known as the guitarist for the punk band the Slits. Albertine was also a member of the Flowers of Romance.

name: Siouxsie Sioux
description: English singer, songwriter, musician, and record producer. She is best known as the lead singer of Siouxsie and the Banshees. AllMusic named her as 'one of the most influential British singers of the rock era.'

name: Lorna Doom
description: Lorna Doom, was an American musician best known as the bass guitarist for the punk rock band the Germs from 1976 to 1980, and again after they got back together from 2005 to 2009.

name: Alice Bag
description: American punk rock singer, musician, author, educator and feminist arctivist. She is the lead singer and co-founder of the Bags, one of the first wave of punk bands to form in the mid-1970s in Los Angeles.

name: Exene Cervenka
description: American singer, artist, and poet. She is best known for her work as a singer in the California punk rock band X.

name: Patti Smith
description: American singer-songwriter, musician, author, and poet who became an influential component of the New York City punk rock movement with her 1975 debut album Horses.

name: Joan Jett
description: American musician, record producer and actress. Best known for her work as the frontwoman of Joan Jett & the Blackhearts, and for founding and performing with the Runaways.

name: Debbie Harry
description: American singer, songwriter and actress, known as the lead vocalist of the band Blondie. Her recordings with the band reached No. 1 in the US and UK charts on many occasions from 1979 to 2017.

name: Ana da Silva
description: Portuguese musician born in Madeira. Da Silva relocated to London in December 1974, and while studying at Hornsey College of Art, she formed the Raincoats with Gina Birch in 1977

name: Gina Birch
description: English musician and filmmaker, best known as a founding member of post-punk rock band, The Raincoats.

name: Penelope Houston
description: American singer-songwriter best known as the singer for the San Francisco-based punk rock band the Avengers.

name: Poison Ivy
description: Guitarist, songwriter, arranger, producer, and occasional vocalist who co-founded the American punk-rock band The Cramps.

name: Jayne County
description: American singer, songwriter, actress and record producer. She was the vocalist of influential proto-punk band Wayne County & the Electric Chairs. Rock's first openly transgender singer.

name: Patricia Morrison
description: American retired bass guitarist, singer and songwriter. She worked with Bags, the Gun Club, Fur Bible, The Sisters of Mercy, and the Damned.

name: Kira Roessler
description: American musician, singer, and two-time Emmy Award-winning dialogue editor. She is perhaps best known as the bassist for the influential hardcore punk band Black Flag during the 1980s.

name: Kate Corris
description: US American guitarist, founder member of The Slits and The Castrators before joining the Mo-dettes. Her name was also spelled Kate Korus, Kate Korris and Kate Chorus.

name: Jane Crockord
description: Bassist of the female foursome band Mo-dettes, formed in 1979. As a teenage runaway she lived in a squat with her band colleague June Miles, and Sid Vicious and Johnny Rotten from Sex Pistols.

name: Ramona Carlier
description: Also known as Regula Sing. Swiss-born singer for English post-punk group Modettes. She studied ballet and had been the singer of the Swiss band Kleenex for a brief period of time.

name: June Miles
description: British singer and drummer, known for her work with various successful bands and singers in the 1980s. She was a founding member of the post-punk group The Mo-dettes, which lasted from 1979 to 1982.

name: Klaudia Schiff
description: Swiss musician and painter. Played bass guitar and only constant member for Kleenex, formed in 1978 and recalled LiLiPUT in 1980.

name: Marlene Marder
description: Swiss punk guitarist. Originally a saxophonist, she played in the band Kleenex/LiLiPUT. In 1976 she was one of the founders of the 'Homosexual Women's Group' in Zurich. She wrote a book about Kleenex/Liliput, ran a record store and a concert agency.

name: Alaska
description: Spanish-Mexican singer and tv personality. She has participated in several bands: Kaka de Luxe (1977, the first spanish punk band), Alaska y los Pegamoides, Alaska y Dinarama and Fangoria.

name: Debsey Wykes
description: Vocal and bassist of the english post-punk band Dolly Mixture, formed in 1978. They formed a sharp contrast against the ruling post-punk and angst building up in London around 1979.

name: Rachel Bor
description: Guitarist and vocalist of the english post-punk band Dolly Mixture, formed in 1978. They formed a sharp contrast against the ruling post-punk and angst building up in London around 1979.

name: Hester Smith
description: Drummer of the english post-punk band Dolly Mixture, formed in 1978. They formed a sharp contrast against the ruling post-punk and angst building up in London around 1979.
